data.sentence: The word لَا comes from the root ل ا and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to know/perceive/understand, to acquaint, perceive by senses.. make verses, remark, poetry, poet, verse, art of poetry, feeling, knowledge.. Sirius, which was worshipped by the Arabs in Pagan times.. mark/marker/signs/rites/symbols/observances/ceremonies/practices, the obligatory ordinances/statutes of God.. a place where a thing is known to be.. measure of length.. sheep/goat.. hair, innermost garment.. trees.. a sign of people in war and in a journey, a call or cry by means of which to know another, banner.. mash'ar al-Haram - holy mosque in Muadhalifah (a place which lies between Makkah and Arafat, six miles from Kabah). The name Mash'ar al-Haram is a compound of Mash'ar meaning the place of perception or knowledge and Haram meaning sacred. Ash'ara to make anyone understand, make known to.
data.sentence: The word يَشْعُرُونَ comes from the root ش ع ر and is associated with the meanings: to know/perceive/understand, to acquaint, perceive by senses.. make verses, remark, poetry, poet, verse, art of poetry, feeling, knowledge.. Sirius, which was worshipped by the Arabs in Pagan times.. mark/marker/signs/rites/symbols/observances/ceremonies/practices, the obligatory ordinances/statutes of God.. a place where a thing is known to be.. measure of length.. sheep/goat.. hair, innermost garment.. trees.. a sign of people in war and in a journey, a call or cry by means of which to know another, banner.. mash'ar al-Haram - holy mosque in Muadhalifah (a place which lies between Makkah and Arafat, six miles from Kabah). The name Mash'ar al-Haram is a compound of Mash'ar meaning the place of perception or knowledge and Haram meaning sacred. Ash'ara to make anyone understand, make known to.

data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.

data.meanings: Ayn-Fa-Waw = to forgive/pardon, abound, pass over, forgo, grow, multiply, obliterate all traces, remit, give more than what is due, relinquish right or remit in whole or in part. afina (oblique pl. of afin) - forgiving. afuwwan - very forgiving, name of Allah. afwun - forgiveness, indulgence, surplus, superfluity. ya'fu - to pardon. ufiya - he is pardoned. (It does not necessarily imply the committing of a sin on the part of a person about whom it is used.). . 'afaa (prf. 3rd. m. sing.): pardoned.. 'afau (prf. 3rd. m. pl.): they grew in affluence.. ya'fuu / ya'fuwa (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): pardons, passes over, forgoes.. ya'fu (imp. 3rd. m. sing. juss.): he forgives.. ya'fuuna (impf. 3rd. f. pl.): they forgo.. li ya'fuu (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): they may pardon.. ta'fuu (imp. 2nd. m. pl.): you forgo, pardon.. na'fu (imp. 1st. pl. juss.): we pardon.. i'fu (prt. m. sing): thou pardon.. 'ufiya (pp. 3rd. m. sing.): who has been granted remission.. 'afwa (n.): forgiveness, surplus.. 'afuwwun / 'afuwwan (nom./acc. n.): very forgiving.. 'aafiina (act. pic. m. pl.): those who pardon.
data.sentence: The word عَفَوْا comes from the root ع ف و and is associated with the meanings: Ayn-Fa-Waw = to forgive/pardon, abound, pass over, forgo, grow, multiply, obliterate all traces, remit, give more than what is due, relinquish right or remit in whole or in part. afina (oblique pl. of afin) - forgiving. afuwwan - very forgiving, name of Allah. afwun - forgiveness, indulgence, surplus, superfluity. ya'fu - to pardon. ufiya - he is pardoned. (It does not necessarily imply the committing of a sin on the part of a person about whom it is used.). . 'afaa (prf. 3rd. m. sing.): pardoned.. 'afau (prf. 3rd. m. pl.): they grew in affluence.. ya'fuu / ya'fuwa (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): pardons, passes over, forgoes.. ya'fu (imp. 3rd. m. sing. juss.): he forgives.. ya'fuuna (impf. 3rd. f. pl.): they forgo.. li ya'fuu (imp. 3rd. m. pl.): they may pardon.. ta'fuu (imp. 2nd. m. pl.): you forgo, pardon.. na'fu (imp. 1st. pl. juss.): we pardon.. i'fu (prt. m. sing): thou pardon.. 'ufiya (pp. 3rd. m. sing.): who has been granted remission.. 'afwa (n.): forgiveness, surplus.. 'afuwwun / 'afuwwan (nom./acc. n.): very forgiving.. 'aafiina (act. pic. m. pl.): those who pardon.
